Stock: Atlantic Sea Scallop Unit Stock (sep Northern Gulf of Maine management area)
ABC: FABC defined as the 75% probability of remaining below the true FMSY.

Stock: Atlantic Herring Unit Stock (4 management areas)
Recruitment Assumption: Autoregressive long-term average; Recruitment stanza used to define BRPs was 1992-2019
ABC Control Rule: Biomass Based: When biomass is greater than 0.5 for the ratio of SSB/SSBMSY, the maximum fishing mortality allowed is 80% of FMSY. As biomass declines, fishing mortality declines linearly, and if biomass falls below 0.1 for the ratio of SSB/SSBMSY, then ABC is set to zero, no fishery allocation.
Comments: The rebuilding plan used the full time series of recruitments when defining reference points and proejctions, which makes them more optimistic than the shortened time frame of recruitments and the AR(1) process applied in 2022 assessment. more optimistic (25% chance of rebuilding in 2025) than those done during this assessment.

ABC Control Rule: Ismooth: BCURRENT x Avg expl. rate
ABC: ABC advice is based on applying the ISmooth multipliers to the most recent 3-year average catch to calculate the Annual Catch Targets (ACT) for the Northern and Southern management areas, the ACT is increased by the management uncertainty buffer (3% for monkfish) to calculate ABCs.

ABC Control Rule: Ismooth: BCURRENT x Avg expl. rate
ABC: ABC advice is based on applying the ISmooth multipliers to the most recent 3-year average catch to calculate the Annual Catch Targets (ACT) for the Northern and Southern management areas, the ACT is increased by the management uncertainty buffer (3% for monkfish) to calculate ABCs.

ABC Control Rule: Groundfish ABC Control Rules: (A) 75%FMY; (B) If 75%FMSY does not achieve mandated rebuilding for overfished stocks, Frebuild; (C) If cannot rebuild even under F=0, ABC should be based on incidental bycatch; (D) interim ABCs for stocks with unknown status on case-bycase basis

Stock Status (known, unknown): Unknown (NOAA fisheries determined overfished and not overfishing)
ABC: Option D ABC control rule; Limiter approach (FY24-25: 168 mt)

Stock: Cape Cod/Gulf of Maine yellowtail flounder

ABC: Option A: 75% of E40%(75% EMSY proxy) using the terminal year fall area-swept estimate

Stock Status (known, unknown): Unknown (NOAA fisheries determined overfished and not overfishing)
ABC: Option D: ABC recommendation was based on use of a 2010-2022 reference period for exploitation (no-possession years) applied to recent biomass estimate (imputied the missing 2020 survey data).
Comments: Fmsy proxy was based on average exploitation rate during no possession years (to current)

Biomass Target (SSBMSY): SSBMSY proxy is derived from reference period (1995-2001)
Fishing Mortality Threshold (FMSY): FMSY proxy is derived from reference period (1995-2001)
ABC: Option A: ABC = 75%OFL; OFLs and ABCs determined by applying the updated FMSY proxy to the terminal year biomass index and applying a constant catch approach for three years.  Reference period for defining the FMSY proxy (1995-2001) is based on response of the stock to a reduced fishing mortality during this period, indicating that changes in the fishing mortality rate were influencing the stock.
Comments: Note:empirical approach for an OFL recommendation

Stock Status (known, unknown): Unknown (Stock is qualitatively considered overfished, with unknown overfishing status. )
ABC: Option D: ABC is based on recent 3-year average swept-area biomass from NEFSC survey (spring & fall) and fixed harvest fraction (2007-2015).

Biomass Target (SSBMSY): median 3-year moving average of NEFSC spring survey biomass index
ABC: Option D: ABC based on previous years catch advice held constant over three years

Stock Status (known, unknown): Unknown (NOAA fisheries determined overfished and not overfishing)
ABC: Option D: ABC = Previous year catch X  catch multiplier

ABC Control Rule: ABC is based on long-term average catch with  decreases informed by monitoring of the LPUE (if LPUE were to drop 15% below the lowest LPUE in the time series, the ABC should be reconsidered)
Comments: Criteria exist to decrease ABC but not defined  to increase

ABC: ABC calculation =Median C/B by species*most recent 3-year moving average of the survey

Biomass Target (SSBMSY): BMSYproxy (also the Btarget) is the 75th percentile of the survey biomass index
Fishing Mortality Threshold (FMSY): Overfishing definitions establish fishing mortality thresholds for all seven skate species based on a percentage decline in the NEFSC trawl survey.

Stock: Northern silver hake (Gulf of Maine/Northern Georges Bank stock)
Reference point Estimation Method: Empirical; Average exploitation reference period (1973-1982) applied to recent biomass estimate; based on period of stability in the survey trends that coincides with a steep change in the relative exploitation rates in the fishery
OFL: OFL derived by applying the FMSY proxy (avg. exploitation rate 1973-1982) to the recent 3-year avg. survey biomass.
ABC: ABC was determined as the 25th percentile of the OFL distribution.

OFL: OFL derived by applying the FMSY proxy (avg. exploitation rate 1973-1982) to the recent 3-year avg. survey biomass.
ABC: ABC was determined as the 25th percentile of the OFL distribution.

Reference point Estimation Method: Exploitation rate reference period: 1981-1994 applied to recent biomass estimate;; period of which the stock seemed to be sustainable and responsive to fisheries management action
Fishing Mortality Threshold (FMSY): Fmsy proxy (average exploitation rate from YEARS)
ABC: ABC based on applying the average exploitation rate from the 1981-1994 reference period to the efficiency-adjusted swept-area biomass estimates

Reference point Estimation Method: Exploitation rate (2001-2019) applied to recent biomass estimate;; period reflects lower exploitation, contemporary conditions, and low stock productivity.
Fishing Mortality Threshold (FMSY): Fmsy proxy (average exploitation rate from YEARS)
ABC: ABC based on applying the average exploitation rate from the 2001-2019  reference period to the efficiency-adjusted swept-area biomass estimates
